jobPostingInfo.title: Communications Specialist, Public Engagement (Temporary)
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities:

  • Senior Communications Specialist will collaborate with multiple teams of professional communicators and mission staff, including international teams, developing strategic messaging and campaigns, utilizing social media, print materials, presentations, outreach events, video, podcasts, and digital content to share NASA Mars achievements and technology advances in Mars science

  • Research industry trends and provide ongoing improvements to public engagement programs and products, including online and in-person experiences

  • Support end-to-end creation of public engagement products including concepts, production, inventory management and storage requirements

  • Develop and share NASA science/storytelling using digital communication tools (web, mobile, social media, print, digital and or video) as well as print products to effectively communicate a message that aligns with NASA's communication priorities

  • Implement communications plans and regularly present to senior management and team members both at JPL and NASA Headquarters

  • Work closely with managers to coordinate and review the budget including proposing appropriate budget levels to support communication products and outreach events

  • Propose ideas and plans to senior managers and regularly present to senior management and team members both at JPL and NASA Headquarters

  • Capture metrics and report on project achievements program impacts and provide informed suggestions for improvements

  • Attend project meetings regularly and report on program results and/or communications news

  • Work with NASA Headquarters, center counterparts, international partners, mission managers and Principal Investigators (PIs) to create a mutually beneficial partnership with ongoing communication and customer service.

  • Periodic travel to support public engagement events and conferences to represent NASA communication initiatives

Qualifications:

  • Typically requires a Bachelor's degree in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, Journalism, or related subject area degree, with a minimum of 6 years of related experience; or Master's degree with at least 4 years of relevant experience.

  • Ability to distill complex science and engineering topics into brief, colorful, and understandable materials for the public

  • Excellent writing, editing (web/photo/video/text), digital content creation, presentation and communication skills; Knowledge of online best practices

  • Consistent track record producing and delivering high impact events, experiences and products

  • Ability to establish partnerships and collaborate with high level stakeholders and handling a variety of strategic and budgetary planning

  • Experience developing and implementing large scale communications campaigns and reporting metrics

  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office, Google Suite, project management software, Adobe Creative Suite, Slack and social media platforms

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with NASA Communications, Public Engagement or Education (formal or informal) including non-profits, academic institutions and research organizations

  • Knowledge of applicable JPL and NASA policies and procedures as well as government regulations

  • Additional background in planetary science a plus

Note: As a temporary position, this assignment may last up to 36 months in duration with approvals based on 12-month assignments.  However, please note that you are not under any employment contract and your temporary employment status can be terminated at any time, with or without notice.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
